channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2024050734
item.description:
Report X-2024050734

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-21T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-13
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON WET UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS 2 X 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF SOFT SWIM C CLARIFIER ONE 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP ALLOWING .25 GALLONS TO RELEASE EACH PLASTIC BOTTLE WAS IN A PLASTIC BAG ZIP TIED CLOSED BUT NO SLOTTED PARTITIONS OR ABSORBENT WAS FOUND. FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS FOLLLOWED CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.description:
Report X-2024050712

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-04
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER REPORTED TO DOOR 441, WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. FIBERBOARD BOX WAS ON FLOOR WITH A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID WETTING BOX. NO LIQUID ON FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP. RESPONDER PLACE FIBERBOARD BOX IN GREEN DMP BAG AND REMOVED TO DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024050673
item.description:
Report X-2024050673

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-02
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EMPLOYEE PICKED UP PACKAGE IN UNLOAD. BROUGHT TO DMP AREA. PACKAGE HAD SMALL WET AREA ON TOP OF BOX WITH CORROSIVE 8 LABEL. READ DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET FOR A CORROSIVE 8 LEAKING PACKAGE AND FOLLOWED ALL THE RESPONSE STEPS. NO LIQUID WAS SPILLED FROM BOX. RESPONDER PROCESSED THE DAMAGE THROUGH THE DMP AND REFERRED TO THE WASTE DISPOSAL CHART FOR DISPOSITION. RESPONDER READ DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST AFTER DISPOSAL PROCESS.

item.title: Report X-2024050639
item.description:
Report X-2024050639

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-17T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: READING
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Norfolk Southern
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UTLX 125128 was reported by PUC inspector of possible dried material near BOV. Contractor was hired to investigate and found no issue with BOV but car had dried spots on the car. Contractor proceeded to the top of car and further investigation found frangible disk was ruptured. When removed to replace contractor found that two ruptured disk were in place. Disks were removed and a new disk was applied. Car was cleaned and returned to transportation.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: shipment was taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package was found already damage wet and leaking on trailer # 840477 upon inspection of inner content 4 x 4 L glass bottles of isopropanol alcohol 1 x 4 L glass bottle was cracked allowing all 4 L to leak out package had no slotted partitions or absorbent was found Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024050247
item.description:
Report E-2024050247

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-15T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-09
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-LOGISTICS contacted ERTS regarding a leaking lid on a 55-gallon poly drum containing SaniDate 5.0. The lid appeared to be not sealed tight enough or not sealed correctly. This resulted in an estimated 1-cup release of product onto the top of the poly drum, the plastic shrink-wrap, and cardboard. A Contractor removed the impacted plastic shrink wrap and cardboard and submerged them in water. The leaking drum was overpacked into a 95-gallon DF. In total, 2 drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.
